glsa.title: Snort: Denial of service
glsa.synopsis: Snort contains a vulnerability in the rule matching algorithm that could result in a Denial of Service.

background.p: Snort is a widely deployed intrusion detection program.

description.p: Randy Smith, Christian Estan and Somesh Jha discovered that the rule matching algorithm of Snort can be exploited in a way known as a "backtracking attack" to perform numerous time-consuming operations.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send specially crafted network packets, which would result in the cessation of the detections and the consumption of the CPU resources.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
